item.description:
How about biking Martha's Vineyard? I have never been :( but I hear the island is fairly flat and easy. With a lot of towns to ride to and explore I am sure this will be a treat.

Transportation- use the Steamship Authority ferry (schedule) from Woods Hole.
http://www.steamshipauthority.com/ssa/documents/MV0620to09052012.pdf

$8 one way per person, $4 one way for bike. The one thing I like about this ferry is that you can get off and on from either Vineyard Haven or Oak Bluffs depending on what time we leave Woods Hole.

Bring helmet, water and a snack, we will most likely stop along the way to get something to eat.

There is bike rental and they deliver to where you are but it is expensive ($25 day), you can reserve online.
http://www.marthasvineyardbike.com/marthas-vineyard-bike-rentals.php

Rain, hurricane, inclement weather cancels but it will be rescheduled.

Parking info and directions: ($12)
http://www.steamshipauthority.com/ssa/parking.cfm?Loc=WH
http://www.steamshipauthority.com/ssa/ParkDirections.cfm?Loc=WH

Carpooling might be ideal, please share gas and parking expenses if you opt to do this.

update 6/15: Passenger tickets can be purchased at all Steamship Authority terminals, Peter Pan/Bonanza Terminals & Plymouth and Brockton Bus Lines Terminals. Passengers never need a reservation but we recommend arriving thirty minutes prior to sailing time, as we sometimes reach vessel passenger capacity on busy weekends and holidays.
item.name: Martha's Vineyard Bike Day
